meanings.definition: The quality or state of being nasty.
meanings.sent1: The nastiness of the spoiled milk made me gag.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't stand the nastiness of the garbage left on the street.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the nastiness of the slimy bug crawling on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The nastiness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over us.
meanings.sent5: The vivid nastiness of the rotten fruit filled the room with a terrible smell.

meanings.definition: An unpleasant or offensive quality or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a hint of nastiness that made it hard to watch.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't tolerate the nastiness of the rude comments.
meanings.sent3: The dog's playful bark had a hint of nastiness that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The nastiness of the gossip spread like wildfire through the office.
meanings.sent5: The chef's soup had a surprising nastiness that left a bad taste in my mouth.
